subject: Critical Thinking
title: What Is Logic and Why Does It Matter?
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: What Is Logic and Why Does It Matter?.

hook.text: You use logic hundreds of times a day without noticing. Every 'if-then' thought is logic in disguise.

buildup.text: Logic is the study of correct reasoning â€” the rules that separate good arguments from bad ones.

discovery.text: The Greeks formalized logic 2,400 years ago. It became the foundation of math, science, and law.

twist.text: But humans are naturally terrible at logic. Our brains evolved for survival, not syllogisms.

climax.text: Learning logic doesn't make you smarter. It makes you harder to fool â€” including by yourself.

punchline.text: Logic is your brain's error-correction software.
